metadata.Title: CVE-2020-6851 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: OpenJPEG through 2.3.1 has a heap-based buffer overflow in opj_t1_clbl_decode_processor in openjp2/t1.c because of lack of opj_j2k_update_image_dimensions validation. It was discovered that OpenJPEG did not properly handle certain input. If OpenJPEG were supplied with specially crafted input, it could be made to crash or possibly execute arbitrary code.

criterions.comment: blender: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
ghostscript: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
insighttoolkit4: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
texmaker: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
